text: Erigeron tianschanicus is an Asian species of flowering plants in the daisy family. It grows on open slopes in Xinjiang and Kazakhstan. Erigeron tianschanicus is a perennial, clumping-forming herb up to 60 cm (2 feet) tall, producing woody rhizomes and a branching caudex. Its flower heads have blue ray florets surrounding yellow disc florets.Flora of China, Erigeron tianschanicus Botschantzev, 1959. 天山飞蓬 tian shan fei peng ==References== tianschanicus Category:Flora of Xinjiang Category:Flora of Kazakhstan Category:Tian Shan Category:Plants described in 1948
title: Erigeron tianschanicus
